comment.author: 8110957@N08
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called ANYTHING GOES ENGLAND,VINTAGE PHOTOS,POSTCARDS,EPHEMERAetc..., and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The dome is St. Paul's. See www.flickr.com/photos/slrjester/2186849517/ and www.phillprice.com/index.php/2009/01/13/st-pauls-and-blac... for recent photos. Note: "Blackfriars" is all one word.

comment.author: 72429059@N00
comment._content: The second bridge in the pic is the old Blackfriars rail bridge, removed in 1985 - the piers are still there, and I think they will be re-used in the Blackfriars Station refurbishment.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: swanq: Thanks for the information. We will both correct the term to 'Blackfriars' and add a note about the presence of St. Paul's in the background when we update the record.
